sub_topic: Finding the Hamiltonian cycle in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

```
+---+  +---+  +---+  +---+
| A |  | B |  | C |  | D |
+---+  +---+  +---+  +---+
  |      |      |      |
  +------+------|------+
         |      |
         +------+

```

Find a Hamiltonian cycle of the given graph (if one exists).
message_2:
A Hamiltonian cycle is a closed loop on a graph where every node (vertex) is visited exactly once.

In the given graph, we can find a Hamiltonian cycle as follows:

A -> B -> C -> D -> A

This cycle visits each vertex exactly once and returns to the starting vertex, A.
